description: theo- (“god”) (from Ancient Greek θεός (theós, “god”)) + -crasy (“mixing”) (from Ancient Greek κρᾶσις (krâsis, “mixing”, “tempering”))

entries.meaning: (Neopagan theology) Interaction, admixture, and conflation of divine principles.
examples: Duotheism1 (two deities) is what Neopagans call a religion in which the duotheologians claim that there are two deities, usually of opposite gender, and that all other spirits are aspects or faces of these two, through a process known as theocrasy2 (deity mingling).
